Data: 9.25am Australia have won the toss and will bat.
Edwards to Marsh, 1 run stays over the wicket to the left hander who squeezes a full and swinging delivery out to square and they're off the mark immediately

Edwards to Watson, 1 run bangs in short, some swing away, Watson squares behind it, the outside edge not carrying to second slip, bouncing just in front. Some immediate encouragement for West Indies and Edwards, however
Edwards to Marsh, no run good ball, some decent carry and at 85.2mph, nips away off the seam after pitching on a good length and the batsman quickly draws his bat in
Edwards to Marsh, no run again some good pace and carry off the deck, it's left as it comes in on a good length
Edwards to Marsh, no run fired again across him, flatter this time, left alone
Edwards to Marsh, no run on off stump, defended on the front foot into the covers with a slight push and they decide not to run
Powell to Watson, 1 run some movement off the seam back in to the right hander, Powell generating plenty of awkward bounce. In the end it's tucked down off the hips in line with off
Powell to Marsh, no run shortish ball on off, coming across him, the batsman caught in two minds shaping initially for the pull and ends up stopping on the shot

Powell to Marsh, FOUR runs gets hold of the pull this time! Just a fraction short from Powell and Marsh is so quick to tranfer his weight and send it fairly aerial - deliberately - and straight through square
Powell to Marsh, no run hustles up to him now, the ball slanting across him and the batsman shapes to cut but it goes through
Powell to Marsh, no run stifled appeal but the batsman had got some bat on to it as he tried to squeeze to square - the ball also pitched outside leg
Powell to Marsh, FOUR runs short and cut hard off the back foot through point. The shot was there for the making
Edwards to Watson, no run some width outside off, driven straight to the man at cover
Edwards to Watson, no run big width outside off, cut down without much power, into the turf and on towards first slip, Gayle putting both hands above his head and parrying it down
Edwards to Watson, no run fired flat and hard down the channel, Watson looks to cut but the ball deceives him as it nips back in off the seam and goes over the blade

Edwards to Watson, no run some swing outside off and down the channel, probing once more and beating Watson again who offers the shot off the back foot, stuck in his crease - no footwork of which to speak
Edwards to Watson, FOUR runs strays on to the legs now and Watson breaks the shackles with a strong clip off the legs through square
Edwards to Watson, FOUR runs on the legs once more and again it's turned off the legs for some more easy runs
Powell to Marsh, no run some movement away off the seam, good pace and carry, the batsman shoulders arms
Powell to Marsh, no run some late swing, the ball starting outside the legs and carrying back in and it's whipped off the legs behind square
Powell to Marsh, 1 run on the legs again and turned out firmly to deep square and they will collect just the single
Powell to Watson, no run a good leave from Watson, the ball coming back in from just outside off, shouldering arms and letting it go through
Powell to Watson, 1 run nipped back in from outside off, pushed into the covers and they run well through
Powell to Marsh, 1 run tapped away to short midwicket on the legs
Edwards to Marsh, no run carries slickly through across him, Marsh's feet stuck in the crease as he's caught in two minds whether to go forward or back
Edwards to Marsh, (no ball) FOUR runs oh! Just wide of the diving man at point, Marshall, but it's a no-ball as well and so up comes the free hit
Edwards to Marsh, FOUR runs short on the legs and he stands tall and almost-Hayden-like, he shoulders the ball through midwicket
Edwards to Marsh, 2 runs width outside off, cuts hard off the back foot, a good diving effort on the third man boundary by Miller, the left-hand spinner running round from his left
Edwards to Marsh, FOUR runs outside off, some big width and he climbs into a hard cut off the back foot in front of point
Edwards to Marsh, no run round the wicket now, and played back down into the turf
Edwards to Marsh, no run low full toss, driven to the covers
Powell to Watson, no run oh, full delivery and he drives an inside edge on to the pads, in the air a while and falls just short of gully who dived forward
Powell to Watson, no run driven on the front foot into the covers now
Powell to Watson, no run width outside off, cut down into the track and out towards point
Powell to Watson, no run banged in short, pulled round to short fine leg, the batsman not quite getting hold of it, playing too late on the shot
Powell to Watson, no run on the front foot, driven out to short midwicket. He's looking quite scratchy today, Watson, there were a few play-and-misses earlier off Edwards
Powell to Watson, 1 run tucked off to point on the front foot
Edwards to Watson, 1 run width outside off, leans and cut down towards backward point
Edwards to Marsh, FOUR runs a half-volley, put away with a firm push through mid-off, Warson did very well to jump over the ball as he was nutmegged and the ball went all the way
Edwards to Marsh, 1 run tucked off the legs out to short midwicket
Edwards to Watson, no run defended on the front foot
Edwards to Watson, no run short ball outside off, pulled straight and flat and hard to mid-on where it just pitched in front of the fielder Findlay who was quickly on his knees
Edwards to Watson, no run outside off, a false shot now, trying to pull it across the line
Powell to Marsh, no run stays over the wicket and pushes it well past the outside edge, the ball moving away off the seam and the batsman playing right inside the line
Powell to Marsh, 1 run outside off, pushed down and they jog through
Powell to Watson, no run pushed on the front foot straight to mid on
Powell to Watson, 1 run width outside off, gets down on one knee and eases it behind point
Powell to Marsh, 1 run full ball on leg, wristed out to short midwicket on the front foot
Powell to Watson, 1 run outside off, played out to point off the back foot this time
Bravo to Watson, no run defended on the front foot
Bravo to Watson, 1 run on off, pulled out to short midwicket
Bravo to Marsh, no run played forward now
Bravo to Marsh, 1 run flat-pulled out to mid off
Bravo to Watson, FOUR runs short ball and pulled through square
Bravo to Watson, 1 run played forward and they jog through
Powell to Watson, 1 run squeezed off the legs in line with middle and turned behind square
Powell to Marsh, no run full ball outside off, pushed into the covers defensively
Powell to Marsh, FOUR runs outside off and he opens the face to run the ball through third man, the ball coming off a thick outside edge of the shoulder of the bat
Powell to Marsh, no run outside off, looks to pull it round, but an under edge bounces way in front of the keeper, having deviated back in just past off stump
Powell to Marsh, no run outside off, the batsman shoulders arms
Bravo to Watson, 1 run turned off the legs to short midwicket
Bravo to Marsh, no run played on the front foot
Bravo to Marsh, no run shoulders arms and lets the ball go flat and wide across him
Bravo to Marsh, 1 run big width outside off, the batsman works it out hard through extra cover
Bravo to Watson, no run on the legs, gets right over it and wrists it down to fine leg
Bravo to Watson, 1 run played down off the back foot to third man
Powell to Watson, FOUR runs scooped with some impressive wrists out to deep midwicket, almost stopping on the shot
Powell to Watson, no run outside off and pulled hard to midwicket
Powell to Watson, no run played hard on the front foot
Powell to Watson, 1 run drives out to mid on, dragged away again
Powell to Marsh, 1 run slower ball on the legs, driven out to mid on and they run through hard
Powell to Watson, no run tucked down off the back foot in line with off, good slower delivery to end the over
Bravo to Marsh, 1 run defended forward and they charge through
Bravo to Watson, no run outside off, played back down forward
Bravo to Watson, no run down leg, and tried to turn it round and Bravo grimaces in follow through, in some discomfort
Bravo to Watson, no run on middle, pushes it out in front of midwicket
Bravo to Watson, OUT big width outside off, cut off the back foot down to third man and Powell comes round and takes the catch
Bravo to Ronchi, 2 runs off the mark straight away with a turn off the legs to deep backward square leg
Powell to Marsh, 1 run pushed off the legs to midwicket
Powell to Ronchi, no run stifled appeal, perhaps drifting down leg, Ronchi brushing off the legs
Powell to Ronchi, no run defended back down into the covers
Powell to Ronchi, no run nipped back in off the seam, played down, he thinks he's bowled him, but the ball crashes into the turf and bounces right over the sticks
Powell to Ronchi, no run nipped back in from outside off, pushed into the covers once more
Powell to Ronchi, FOUR runs outside off and worked away well through midwicket
Bravo to Marsh, no run width outside off, cut into the covers
Bravo to Marsh, no run shoulders arms and lets this one go through
Bravo to Marsh, no run slashes hard at a cut, the ball goes through
Bravo to Marsh, no run outside off, the batsman shoulders arms

Bravo to Marsh, 1 run width again, outside off, squeezed into the covers and the throw comes in hard at the non-striker's end but even a direct hit wouldn't have caused too many problems for the third umpire
Bravo to Ronchi, no run driven out to mid on
Gayle to Marsh, 1 run on the front foot, pushed into the covers, some hesitation in the running
Gayle to Ronchi, SIX runs outside off and great shot from Ronchi, lifting it over mid off and it goes aerial
Gayle to Ronchi, no run pushed into the covers
Gayle to Ronchi, SIX runs outside off, and there he goes again! Lifts it off the bottom of the bat once more, all shoulders in the straight drive
Gayle to Ronchi, no run outside off, pushes it down

Gayle to Ronchi, SIX runs once more he goes! The third six of the over, launching off the bottom of the bat yet again and over long off it goes, the ball going fairly flat. Caught well by the sightscreen attendant in the deep
Bravo to Marsh, no run driven down the ground on the front foot
Bravo to Marsh, no run some width outside off, cut at it and played right over
Bravo to Marsh, no run outside off, let it go through
Bravo to Marsh, no run once more, lets it go through
Bravo to Marsh, no run outside off, pushed into the covers
Bravo to Marsh, 1 run driven to the covers and they run through well
Edwards to Marsh, no run pushed up there in line with off, defended on the front foot
Edwards to Marsh, 1 run a quick single through again
Edwards to Ronchi, no run short and straight and the batsman is quick to duck down. Some good aggression from Edwards
Edwards to Ronchi, (no ball) SIX runs on middle and it's lifted again, straight once more, a clean hit high and dipping just over the rope
Edwards to Ronchi, 2 runs down the legs and he can't quite adjust his shoulders in the pull to deep square leg
Edwards to Ronchi, SIX runs short ball, clubbed away, this time right over long on to bring up his fifth six from a mere 16 deliveries
Edwards to Ronchi, no run width outside off, backs away, looking for it again and his cut scythes only fresh air and he quickly has a laugh at himself
Bravo to Marsh, 1 run the batsman drops it down and they run through quickly
Bravo to Ronchi, 1 run comes out on the legs, pushes out on the legs and they will have to be quick if they want two
Bravo to Marsh, 1 run outside off, cut into the covers now
Bravo to Ronchi, 2 runs round the wicket, on to the legs and pulled hard through square and a wayward return
Bravo to Ronchi, FOUR runs outside off, opens up the face and that's a tremendous shot
Bravo to Ronchi, FOUR runs back over the head of the bowler this time and he's raining down the blows
Edwards to Marsh, 2 runs on the legs, flicked away to the legs and they run through the second
Edwards to Marsh, OUT outside off, chased the ball away from his body, and a thick snick is pouched gratefully by the keeper
Edwards to Clarke, 1 run off the mark immediately with a tuck off the legs behind square

Edwards to Ronchi, FOUR runs outside off, a strong drive through the covers to bring up his fifty which is roundly applauded by his team-mates. It's the equal second-fastest ODI fifty by an Australian
Edwards to Ronchi, (no ball) banged in hard, the batsman bends his back and shapes to cut and there's yet another no-ball from the bowler
Edwards to Ronchi, SIX runs outside off and that's just special, backs away and somehow muscles it over long off, it's gone a long way
Bravo to Clarke, 1 wide a very wide down off
Bravo to Clarke, no run full pitched now, defended on the front foot
Bravo to Clarke, 2 runs outside off, pushed into the covers and they run through
Bravo to Clarke, no run on the front foot, pushed to mid on and a pumped-up pair look to squeeze out the single but that would have been calamitous from their point of view
Bravo to Clarke, 1 run on middle, driven off the legs with a closed bat face, a flick really, out to midwicket
Bravo to Ronchi, FOUR runs outside off, driven well through the covers and Ronchi collects another boundary
Bravo to Ronchi, 1 run driven straight and hard out to long on and some great fielding in the deep by Findlay, diving to his left

Miller to Ronchi, OUT and the change pays immediate dividends! The stands erupt and there are muted, relieved smiles from the players as he draws him forward and he steers an edge to Ramdin who takes a lowish catch at the third attempt
Miller to Hussey, 1 run outside off, squeezed to the covers and he too is off the mark straight away
Miller to Clarke, no run round the wicket now, defended back down the line
Miller to Clarke, no run stays round, up there on off, defended back forward
Miller to Clarke, no run outside off, presents a firm face with a defensive towards the covers
Miller to Clarke, 1 run backs away to give himself room to drive out to mid off

Sarwan to Clarke, OUT Sarwan breaks through with his first ball, too! Clarke backs away to try to cut out to point, but takes a faint outside edge - though one which was obvious enough - and Ramdin snaps it up
Sarwan to Symonds, no run defended on the front foot
Sarwan to Symonds, no run again defended, Sarwan coming round the wicket here
Sarwan to Symonds, no run more defence, some good control from Sarwan here
Sarwan to Symonds, no run pitches back in towards him and driven back forward
Miller to Hussey, 1 run outside off, some turn back in and the batsman plays with the spin, working it out to square
Miller to Symonds, no run outside off, played back down the line off the back foot
Miller to Symonds, no run defended back down the line
Miller to Symonds, no run on the back foot, squeezed out to the gully
Miller to Symonds, no run keeps him quiet yet again, Symonds defending down off the back foot
Miller to Symonds, no run outside off, pushed into the covers
Sarwan to Hussey, 1 run some turn back in from outside off, and worked with the spin, pulling it to square
Sarwan to Symonds, no run forces the front-foot defensive this time
Sarwan to Symonds, no run defended on the front foot
Sarwan to Symonds, 1 run played on the front foot out to mid off now
Sarwan to Hussey, no run outside off, pushed on the front foot just behind point
Miller to Symonds, no run defended back down the line
Miller to Symonds, no run driven back to the bowler who dives and stops
Miller to Symonds, no run pushed out to the covers
Miller to Symonds, no run Symonds steers off the crouch to point
Miller to Symonds, FOUR runs good power and placement from Symonds, backing away and waiting for the short and loose one which he peels off through point with a cut
Miller to Symonds, 1 run on the front foot now and pushed to the covers
Sarwan to Symonds, no run pushed on the front foot back to the bowler
Sarwan to Symonds, no run defended on the front foot again

Sarwan to Symonds, 1 run on the legs, a leading edge as he tries to turn it to the legs, Chanderpaul takes it, no chance of a run and he flicks it back, wide of the bowler, allowing overthrows (or overflicks)
Sarwan to Hussey, 1 run played on the front foot
Sarwan to Symonds, 1 run turned off the legs this time
Sarwan to Hussey, no run steps out on the front foot and defends forward
Miller to Symonds, no run on the front foot, defended down without too much trouble
Miller to Symonds, 1 run pushed into the covers on the front foot
Miller to Hussey, no run width outside off, turned back in a touch, worked into the covers
Miller to Hussey, 1 run outside off, pushed down to the gully and they seek the single
Miller to Symonds, no run on the front foot, driven straight to the man at cover
Miller to Symonds, 1 run dug out towards mid on
Sarwan to Symonds, 1 run driven out tamely to long on
Sarwan to Hussey, 1 run driven out to long on
Sarwan to Symonds, 1 run squeezes out a drive to long on
Sarwan to Hussey, no run gets right over in defence
Sarwan to Hussey, 1 run outside off again and pushes to point
Sarwan to Symonds, 1 run outside off, cut hard to point
Miller to Symonds, no run played forward
Miller to Symonds, 2 runs outside off again, opens the face and runs it down behind point, Bravo doing very well on the boundary with the slide and stop
Miller to Symonds, no run defended forward
Miller to Hussey, 1 run outside off, turns back in and is worked out off the back foot
Miller to Symonds, no run on the front foot, defended back down in line with off on the front foot
Sarwan to Hussey, 2 runs outside off, pushed out to point and they push for two and get them easily enough
Sarwan to Hussey, 1 run on to the legs, pulled round hard to square
Sarwan to Symonds, no run defended forward
Sarwan to Symonds, no run outside off, pushed out to midwicket
Sarwan to Symonds, no run on the front foot, pushed out to mid off
Sarwan to Symonds, 1 run on the legs, driven out to long on
Miller to Symonds, 1 run defended on the front foot out to mid off
Miller to Hussey, 1 run width outside off, driven into the covers
Miller to Symonds, no run defended on the front foot
Miller to Symonds, no run defended down the line on the back foot
Miller to Symonds, no run outside off, let it go through
Miller to Symonds, no run played off the back foot to mid off
Sarwan to Hussey, no run outside off, turned back in, and fended down off the back foot
Sarwan to Hussey, FOUR runs some width outside off and driven well through the covers
Sarwan to Hussey, 1 run on the front foot, pushed out to short midwicket
Sarwan to Symonds, no run on the front foot, pushed out forward
Sarwan to Symonds, 1 run outside off, pushed off the legs to midwicket
Sarwan to Hussey, FOUR runs worked out forward
Miller to Symonds, no run defended on the front foot in line with off
Miller to Symonds, 1 run the lap sweep round to backward square leg now
Miller to Hussey, no run defended on the front foot
Miller to Hussey, no run worked on the front foot to short midwicket
Miller to Hussey, 1 run on the front foot again, driven out to mid on
Miller to Symonds, no run in on middle, wristed out to short midwicket
Sarwan to Hussey, 1 run driven out to mid on
Sarwan to Symonds, FOUR runs outside off and deftly cut down to third man, just opening the face and running it down
Sarwan to Symonds, 1 run on the legs and lofted now out to midwicket
Sarwan to Hussey, FOUR runs on the legs, pulled round in front of square
Sarwan to Hussey, 1 run on the legs, pushed out to square
Sarwan to Symonds, no run on the front foot, pushed to the covers
Miller to Hussey, 1 run outside off, squeezed out to the legs
Miller to Symonds, no run on the legs, pushed to fine leg
Miller to Symonds, 1 run on the front foot, pushed out to the covers
Miller to Hussey, no run attempted reverse sweep gpes awry
Miller to Hussey, no run pushed back out towards the bowler who runs round
Miller to Hussey, 1 run waits on the back foot and plays it at the top of the bounce with a push-drive to mid on
Bravo to Hussey, SIX runs full toss on the knees, driven out over long on and just past Marshall's dive, the fielder nearly landing on a heavy bit of machinery - the roller. Could have been painful
Bravo to Hussey, 1 run outside off, cut out to point
Bravo to Hussey, no run full delivery, dug out and foisted back towards the bowler

Bravo to Hussey, 2 runs outside off, cut back to the bowler, who goes out towards mid on and then his throw spooned out of his arm as he dived and they manage to take an overthrow (or underthrow, as it turned out)
Bravo to Hussey, FOUR runs outside off, cut hard through the covers, a clean shot and Bravo isn't happy with the end of that over to say the least
Gayle to Hopes, 1 run driven out to mid on
Gayle to Hussey, FOUR runs slipped out a full toss on to the legs and the batsman goes for the crashing pull which is top-edged aerially down fine leg
Gayle to Hussey, FOUR runs again angled down the leg side with a full toss, four more as there's an easy pull through backward square
Gayle to Hussey, 1 run backs away, well behind the stumps and drives out to the covers
Gayle to Hopes, FOUR runs goes for the reverse sweep and connects very well indeed, with a firm, well-struck shot behind square
Gayle to Hopes, 1 leg bye on the legs, and on one knee, swept down
Sarwan to Hussey, 1 run swept round to backward square leg
Sarwan to Symonds, 2 runs pushed off the legs to fine leg, they have to hurry but the throw comes in at the non-striker's end, deflects off naughtily and the batsmen steal the extra
Sarwan to Symonds, 1 run outside the legs from over the wicket, swept round
Sarwan to Hussey, 1 run on the legs and pulled hard out to midwicket
Sarwan to Symonds, 1 run pushed forward
Sarwan to Hussey, 1 run turned off the legs to square
Miller to Hussey, no run on the front foot, driven out to short midwicket where Gayle tidies up
Miller to Hussey, no run Gayle's in on the action again with a work out there
Miller to Hussey, 1 run they take the single this time with a dab into the covers
Miller to Symonds, 1 run outside off, turned in a touch, and worked back out to square
Miller to Hussey, no run defended on the front foot
Miller to Hussey, no run width outside off, cut off the back foot to gully
Bravo to Hopes, FOUR runs full toss above the hips on leg and that's crashingly pulled in front of square. It looked like Bravo was aiming for the yorker there
Bravo to Hopes, FOUR runs help-yourself stuff now, Hopes down on one knee and drives hard over long on
Bravo to Hopes, 2 runs outside off, cut well off the back foot to deep cover
Bravo to Hopes, no run oh, just misses the off stump as Hopes backed away to give himself some room to cut
Bravo to Hopes, 1 run outside off, driven out to mid off
Bravo to Hussey, SIX runs low full toss, Hussey backs away and deposits the ball high and far over straight long off
Sarwan to Hopes, 1 run on the legs, driven up and over towards long on, didn't really get hold of that one
Sarwan to Hussey, SIX runs outside off and Hussey goes large again, this time lifting it hard and flat over long on
Sarwan to Hussey, SIX runs width outside leg now and beefed hard and high between long on and deep midwicket

Sarwan to Hussey, 2 runs shocking. Hang your head in shame, Andre Fletcher. Hussey sends it high and without much power, and he's already walking off thinking he's definitely out, but Fletcher fluffed it big time
Sarwan to Hussey, OUT but Powell makes no mistake at deep backward square leg this time, the fielder coming round and having to reach away from his body with two hands at the last second

Sarwan to Hopes, OUT Fletcher makes amends this time with a much tougher catch than the sitter he dropped two balls ago, Hopes lifting up the ball towards wide mid-on and Fletcher dives forward to take it at full stretch, this time to cheers

Wow, that was pretty breathless stuff, Australia racking up 341 for 8 from their 50 overs, with two quick fifties from Ronchi (22 balls) and David Hussey (19) the highlight. This is their highest total against West Indies for Australia and now the home side will
And here we go for the chase, and what a big task for West Indies ...
Lee to Gayle, no run Gayle goes after the first one outside off, slams it into the turf and it bounces over the stumps
Lee to Gayle, 1 wide Gayle slashes at this one but it's too wide outside off and is called as such by umpire Bucknor
Lee to Gayle, no run left alone outside off this time
Lee to Gayle, no run Gayle drives away from his body, it beats the bat and goes through to Ronchi
Lee to Gayle, FOUR runs and Gayle gets off the mark with a well controlled drive off the back foot, it races away square through point and he gets himself a boundary
Lee to Gayle, 1 run that's a cross-batted club from Gayle, it flies away along the ground to mid off, where Hopes does well to stop it and deflects the ball towards mid on
Lee to Marshall, no run Marshall forward and defends towards cover
Johnson to Gayle, no run right on line immediately and it stays a touch low, Gayle defends
Johnson to Gayle, no run cut away square but straight to point

Johnson to Gayle, OUT and Johnson does the job! It's on a good length and Gayle doesn't quite know whether to go back or forward, he gets a thick edge and Ronchi's great game continues as he dives to his left and takes a very good catch
Johnson to Sarwan, no run Sarwan on the back foot to start, punches it away to cover
Johnson to Sarwan, FOUR runs good way to get off the mark, Sarwan quickly onto a short ball with a bit of width and cuts forward of point for a boundary
Johnson to Sarwan, no run angled across Sarwan, who leaves this one
Lee to Marshall, no run Lee digs this one in, Marshall goes back and defends
Lee to Marshall, FOUR runs Marshall forces this one off the back foot through point, a square drive really and it races away to the boundary
Lee to Marshall, no run Lee probes outside off, Marshall blocks it away
Lee to Marshall, no run pushed away defensively to point

Lee to Marshall, no run Marshall forward and defends, Lee appeals for lbw and it might have flicked the top of the pad before rocketing off the middle of the bat, but certainly outside the line of off
Lee to Marshall, no run a wild attempted drive from Marshall, who flashes outside off and sees the ball whizz past the bat

Johnson to Sarwan, 1 run Sarwan crunches this one wide of point where Clarke makes a terrific diving stop, then turns and throws to the bowler's end where Sarwan was a long, long way short. Lucky for him, Clarke's throw was wide

Johnson to Marshall, 1 run and there's a very quick single, Marshall pushes to cover and scampers through. Symonds is the fielder, he under-arms it into the stumps at the bowler's end but Marshall gets home, you've got to be mighty fast to beat Symonds
Johnson to Sarwan, 1 run another fast run as Sarwan pokes it to mid on, David Hussey's throw misses at the bowler's end
Johnson to Marshall, 1 wide short and down leg side, so that's a wide

Johnson to Marshall, no run straight-bat defence this time, Johnson gets across to cut it off, another shy at the stumps, this time at the striker's end as Marshall was initially wanting a single, the throw missed though
Johnson to Marshall, no run Marshall drives at this one outside off, it beats the bat
Johnson to Marshall, 1 run on the pads and it's tucked away through midwicket for a single
Lee to Marshall, no run on the back foot and punches this one to cover
Lee to Marshall, 1 run straight ball this time, Marshall clips it away through square leg
Lee to Sarwan, no run dead on line again and it stays down a touch, Sarwan jumps then has to adjust and does well to get the bat down on this one
Lee to Sarwan, 1 run driven away to cover and they get a single
Lee to Marshall, no run oh, there's a thick edge from Marshall and it falls just a few centimetres short of Watson at first slip. A stroke of luck for Marshall
Lee to Marshall, no run forward and he defends this back down the pitch
Johnson to Sarwan, no run driven off the back foot to cover and there's no run
Johnson to Sarwan, no run Sarwan backs away and tries for an expansive cut, the shortish one from Johnson bounces a touch too much and beats the bat
Johnson to Sarwan, no run another shortish ball, Sarwan looks to pull but mistimes it and the ball lobs just in front of mid on

Johnson to Sarwan, OUT excellent catch! Sarwan knows he has to get the runs flowing and drives on the up, but it's a slower ball and he doesn't quite time it, the ball looks like clearing James Hopes at mid off but he times his leap to perfection and snare
Johnson to Chanderpaul, no run pushed into the off side, they can't manufacture a single
Johnson to Chanderpaul, 1 run Chanderpaul gets off the mark deflecting this one behind point
Lee to Chanderpaul, 1 wide down leg side and that's a wide, Lee doesn't think it should have been but every umpire will call those
Lee to Chanderpaul, FOUR runs short and on leg, Chanderpaul hooks and it flies over the short fine leg and away to the boundary
Lee to Chanderpaul, no run Chanderpaul looks to cut this one, it beats the bat
Lee to Chanderpaul, no run good ball, fuller length and nipping back in to the left-hander, Chanderpaul good enough to defend
Lee to Chanderpaul, FOUR runs excellent shot, Chanderpaul drives this one sweetly through the vacant cover region for four
Lee to Chanderpaul, 1 run doesn't quite get this one right as he attempts to repeat the shot, a thick inside egde races past the stumps
Lee to Marshall, no run outside off, Marshall defends
Johnson to Chanderpaul, FOUR runs well struck, this one is on the stumps and a half-volley, Chanderpaul simply lifts this one over midwicket and with the field up that's two bounces over the boundary
Johnson to Chanderpaul, no run prodded away into the on side
Johnson to Chanderpaul, 1 run outside off now, Chanderpaul cuts it away behind point
Johnson to Marshall, no run prodded away defensively to cover

Johnson to Marshall, no run dropped! Nathan Bracken puts this one down at short fine leg. Johnson puts it on the pads, Marshall flicks it on the up and Bracken crouches down and fumbles what he definitely should have taken
Johnson to Marshall, no run punched away through the off side
Lee to Chanderpaul, 1 wide short and down leg side, that's a wide
Lee to Chanderpaul, no run driven hard to mid off, finds the fieldsman
Lee to Chanderpaul, no run clubbed straight down into the turf and through to Ronchi
Lee to Chanderpaul, no run Chanderpaul tries for a big drive, mistimes it though and it goes straight back to Lee
Lee to Chanderpaul, 1 wide bad ball, Lee drags this one short and well down leg side
Lee to Chanderpaul, 2 runs pulled away through midwicket and they get a couple
Lee to Chanderpaul, no run this one beats the bat, Chanderpaul looking to cut behind point and it gets a bit too close to him
Lee to Chanderpaul, no run guided away to gully
Johnson to Marshall, no run punched away towards point
Johnson to Marshall, FOUR runs good timing from Marshall, this one is right on line and driven straight back past the bowler
Johnson to Marshall, 1 wide wide of off, he tries for a big drive but it's too wide
Johnson to Marshall, 1 run guided away behind point this time
Johnson to Chanderpaul, no run driven to mid on
Johnson to Chanderpaul, 1 run short outside off, Chanderpaul cuts in the air and it bounces away to third man
Johnson to Marshall, no run and a leading edge from Marshall just lobs over the bowler's head, a stroke of luck for Marshall
Bracken to Chanderpaul, no run defended into the covers
Bracken to Chanderpaul, 2 runs outside off, late cut dropped by Watson at second slip position, clutch-diving to his right
Bracken to Chanderpaul, no run outside off, cuts right over it
Bracken to Chanderpaul, no run defended down off
Bracken to Chanderpaul, 1 run turned into the leg side on the front foot
Bracken to Marshall, 1 run again turned off the legs to fine
Watson to Marshall, no run some lift there, and defended back down off the back foot
Watson to Marshall, no run on the legs, tucked out to midwicket
Watson to Marshall, no run turned off the legs in front of square this time
Watson to Marshall, FOUR runs full toss down the legs, put away with a firm pull through the 45 this time
Watson to Marshall, no run defended back down the line
Bracken to Chanderpaul, 1 run outside off, cut down behind point
Bracken to Findlay, 1 run outside off, pushed off the back foot into the covers
Bracken to Chanderpaul, 1 run pushed to the covers
Bracken to Findlay, 1 run on the legs, bends over, and works it square
Bracken to Chanderpaul, no run width outside off and some swing away, probably just about gets away with that one
Bracken to Chanderpaul, 1 run on middle and off, the batsman strides down and brushes to square
Watson to Chanderpaul, 1 run pushed back down the line towards straight mid off
Watson to Findlay, no run pitches outside off, some movement away, the batsman shoulders arms as it's on a good length
Watson to Findlay, FOUR runs some width outside leg, tucked away behind square
Watson to Findlay, no run outside off, cut to point
Watson to Findlay, 1 run outside off, pushed down to third man
Watson to Chanderpaul, 1 run on the legs, pushed off to square
Bracken to Chanderpaul, no run outside off, cut into the covers
Bracken to Chanderpaul, 1 run tucked off the legs
Bracken to Findlay, FOUR runs outside off, driven on the front foot to the covers
Bracken to Findlay, no run outside off, pushed down without trouble
Bracken to Findlay, 1 run on the front foot, driven out to mid on
Bracken to Chanderpaul, no run pushed forward
Watson to Findlay, 1 run pushed across him, played down on the back foot to the covers
Watson to Chanderpaul, 1 run outside off, cut down off the back foot to third man
Watson to Findlay, no run defended again on the front foot
Watson to Findlay, 1 run turned off the legs to square
Watson to Chanderpaul, FOUR runs outside off, edged away - thickishly and forcefully - and the ball races through third man
Watson to Chanderpaul, 1 run full delivery, lands on the toes in line with off, pushed forward straight
Bracken to Chanderpaul, 1 run wristed off the legs to square
Bracken to Findlay, no run on the front foot, driven out to long on
Bracken to Findlay, 1 leg bye on the legs, turned square
Bracken to Chanderpaul, no run outside off, cut to backward point
Bracken to Chanderpaul, no run outside off, cut to point
Bracken to Chanderpaul, no run played out square
Watson to Findlay, no run on the legs, pushed out to midwicket
Watson to Findlay, 1 run pushed off the legs through midwicket
Watson to Chanderpaul, 1 run on the back foot outside off, pushed out to the covers
Watson to Findlay, no run flicked off the legs and snapped up by Lee at backward square leg, Lee's not sure if he caught it or not
Watson to Findlay, no run defended back down straight in line with off
Watson to Findlay, no run defended on the front foot
Bracken to Chanderpaul, no run turned off the legs
Bracken to Chanderpaul, 1 run outside off, cut through backward point
Bracken to Findlay, 1 run outside off, cut away off the back foot
Bracken to Chanderpaul, 1 run width outside off, worked out behind point
Bracken to Findlay, no run on middle, driven back out to long on
Bracken to Findlay, no run outside off, pushed to point
Watson to Chanderpaul, 1 run outside off, driven to wide mid on
Watson to Findlay, no run slanted across him, the batsman thinks about playing, and indeed dabs at it, his feet rooted to the crease, and the ball goes over
Watson to Findlay, 1 run on middle and off, wristed off to square
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run on the legs, pulled round to square
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run stays over the wicket, a straightish line up there on off, defended forward
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run outside off, wristed towards the bowler who stops it with two hands to the left
Clarke to Findlay, 1 run driven out to the covers
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run pushed back to the bowler

Clarke to Chanderpaul, OUT super catch from Lee, Chanderpaul offers the skier, and Lee sets himself at long off to receive, palms upwards, and tumbles back with the momentum, but the ball pouched safely
Clarke to Findlay, no run defended on the front foot back in line with off
Clarke to Findlay, no run outside off, the batsman takes one step to think about it, before pulling out
Clarke to Findlay, no run defended on the front foot
Symonds to Bravo, no run defended on the front foot
Symonds to Bravo, no run defended on th e back foot now
Symonds to Bravo, 1 run on middle, turned out to midwicket
Symonds to Findlay, no run round the wicket, pushes it down off, the batsman shoulders arms
Symonds to Findlay, no run width outside off, cut out to point
Symonds to Findlay, no run width again outside off, cut to point once more
Clarke to Bravo, no run round the wicket, pushes it up on the toes, and it's accordingly pushed out to the covers
Clarke to Bravo, no run pushed into the covers again
Clarke to Bravo, 1 run an edge outside off
Clarke to Findlay, 2 runs big width outside off, cut out to deep point
Clarke to Findlay, no run outside off, throws his hands and shoulders at that one, but doesn't quite connect
Clarke to Findlay, FOUR runs on off, pulled round in front of midwicket and goes on to towards the rope
Symonds to Bravo, 1 wide width outside off - too much for the umpire's liking
Symonds to Bravo, no run Symonds is employing spin today, by the way, and now it's up there on off, defended on the front foot
Symonds to Bravo, no run moved to short midwicket
Symonds to Bravo, 1 run pushed on the front foot to the covers
Symonds to Findlay, 2 runs width outside off, driven up and over towards the covers
Symonds to Findlay, no run round the wicket now, some width outside off, the batsman plays it into the covers
Symonds to Findlay, no run pushed up there and it goes on with the arm, the batsman defends down without too much trouble
Clarke to Bravo, 1 run pushed off the legs and they think of coming back for the second
Clarke to Findlay, SIX runs outside off, kneels down and deposits very straight over long off
Clarke to Findlay, FOUR runs driven hard through the covers now
Clarke to Findlay, no run pushed across him on to off, played back out forward
Clarke to Findlay, 1 run on middle, turned off the legs to square
Clarke to Bravo, 2 runs outside off, driven out fairly square between point and cover - cover point you could say
Symonds to Findlay, no run outside off, defended down
Symonds to Findlay, 1 run psuehd forward to the covers
Symonds to Bravo, 1 run dragged it down on to the legs and turned with the spin behind square
Symonds to Findlay, 1 run down leg, scooped off the hips behind square
Symonds to Bravo, no run on middle and off, defended on the front foot
Clarke to Findlay, 1 run outside off, driven to the covers
Clarke to Bravo, 1 run tucked off the legs to square
Clarke to Findlay, 1 run outside off, pressed into the covers on the front foot
Clarke to Bravo, no run comes in to the batsman who defends back on the front foot in line with off
Clarke to Bravo, no run outside off, driven to the covers off the back foot now
Clarke to Bravo, 1 run extra loop, driven down towards mid on
Symonds to Bravo, FOUR runs fluffed by Bracken on the boundary, his long legs going for a big slide and that was in front of the fielding coach Mike Young. Oops
Symonds to Fletcher, no run outside off, pushes off the back foot to the covers
Symonds to Fletcher, no run pushed out to the covers once more
Symonds to Fletcher, no run full delivery on off, pushed back to the bowler now
Symonds to Fletcher, 1 run some swing away outside off, pushed into the covers
Clarke to Ramdin, 1 run outside off, driven hard to the covers and he's off the mark
Clarke to Findlay, 1 run on the front foot, pressed down to the gully

Clarke to Ramdin, 1 run right up there on off, driven to mid on and there's a collision with Umpire Bucknor who's smiling, Ramdin isn't, though. It was quite amusing, though, he nearly rugby tackled the umpire. Ramdin seems OK now
Clarke to Findlay, 1 run worked out off the back foot to gully
Clarke to Ramdin, no run pushed on to middle and leg, the batsman's a bit cramped for room, he tries to make more and pushes forward
Clarke to Ramdin, no run drops his hands down on it at the last second
Symonds to Findlay, 1 run outside off, driven through mid off
Symonds to Ramdin, 1 run outside off, cut out to deep cover and quickly returned
Symonds to Findlay, 1 run outside off, flat-battedly pulled back towards the bowler who jumps but can't quite get a fingertip on it

Symonds to Ramdin, OUT in the air and a great catch in the deep to remove Ramdin, Michael Hussey charging in from the rope to take a good catch tumbling forward, ending up in a diving position but with the ball safe in his hands
Symonds to Findlay, 2 runs down the legs and paddled up with a sweep and down to fine leg, Lee with the slide on the rope
Symonds to Findlay, no run defended on the front foot
Clarke to Powell, 1 run on the legs, turned to fine leg, Powell's off the mark
Clarke to Findlay, 1 run on leg and he goes for a booming drive, just over the head of Symonds at midwicket
Clarke to Powell, no run outside off, played off the back foot into the covers
Clarke to Powell, no run attempts the sweep but swivels round right in front of the keeper. A sure sign of desperation
Clarke to Powell, 1 run pushed out to the covers
Clarke to Findlay, no run defended on the front foot back in line with off
Symonds to Powell, no run on off, defended forward
Symonds to Powell, no run digs it out defensively in line with middle and off
Symonds to Powell, 1 run turns back in and driven back out off the back foot towards long off
Symonds to Findlay, 1 run width outside off, cut out to backward point
Symonds to Powell, no run on middle, attempts the sweep, doesn't get it quite right
Symonds to Powell, no run defended on the front foot
Lee to Findlay, 1 run short ball on the legs, tucked round to fine leg and Findlay brings up his first one-day fifty for West Indies, taking 56 deliveries
Lee to Powell, 1 run banged in short on off and pulled round to midwicket
Lee to Findlay, 1 run low full toss, dipping down, pushed out to the covers on the front foot
Lee to Powell, no run another low full toss, pushed to the covers on the front foot
Lee to Powell, no run full ball outside off, dug out forward
Lee to Powell, FOUR runs banged in short, hooks this one up high in the air but gets away with it as it goes through fine leg - debate as to whether it's a four or six but ruled four in the end
Symonds to Findlay, 1 wide outside off, pushed to the gully
Symonds to Findlay, no run width outside off
Symonds to Findlay, no run on middle and leg, big call for lbw, not given, it looked to be going down leg
Symonds to Findlay, 1 run turned off the legs to just behind square
Symonds to Powell, no run on the legs, pushed forward
Symonds to Powell, no run played forward once more
Symonds to Powell, 1 run on the legs, turned down to fine leg
Lee to Powell, no run outside off, let this one go down, fairly wide
Lee to Powell, 1 run outside off and that's a well-connected pull, Powell walking right over his stumps and sending it behind square
Lee to Findlay, no run round the wicket, sends it hard and full down the channel
Lee to Findlay, 1 run banged in a touch short, the batsman playing right back down the line
Lee to Powell, no run moves back as Lee sends in a full one and drops the return chance, a sharp one admittedly but he did clutch at it
Lee to Powell, no run low full toss on off, pushed out to short midwicket
Johnson to Findlay, 1 leg bye on middle and leg and the batsman bends over as he pushes it out to square
Johnson to Powell, no run outside off, peels a hard flashing Calypso heave at it - and connects with air
Johnson to Powell, no run defended on the front foot in line with off
Johnson to Powell, no run fired down the off-side channel
Johnson to Powell, no run fired once more

Johnson to Powell, OUT got him! Johnson picks up his third wicket, bowling Powell comprehensively as the batsman tried to steer a straight one to midwicket, his bat at an awkward angle, and the ball ricocheted on to off stump from the pad
Lee to Findlay, no run defended forward
Lee to Findlay, no run round the wicket, speared in on off, defended down
Lee to Findlay, no run full toss on the thighs, pushed out to the covers, more evasively than anything, one hand coming up off the bat
Lee to Findlay, 1 run low full toss pushed out to the covers
Lee to Miller, no run low full toss, dug out back down the pitch
Lee to Miller, 1 run banged in short outside off, the batsman opens the face and runs it down to third man
Johnson to Miller, 1 run short and some width outside off, cut off the back foot behind point
Johnson to Findlay, no run oh, nearly drags it back on to his stumps there
Johnson to Findlay, 1 run outside off, cut hard to point off the back foot
Johnson to Miller, 1 run on off, cut down off the back foot behind point
Johnson to Findlay, no run defended on the front foot back in line with off
Johnson to Findlay, no run outside off, some good lift from the deck, the batsman chases it with a hard cut off the back foot, but connects only with air
Lee to Miller, no run on off, pushed down off the back foot into the covers
Lee to Miller, no run dragged it down a touch short, cut hard off the back foot to the covers
Lee to Miller, 1 run on off, turned to midwicket
Lee to Findlay, no run outside off, played into the covers
Lee to Findlay, no run outside off - comes from very wide in fact - and angles in at the left hander who leaves it
Lee to Findlay, FOUR runs outside off, cut hard off the back foot through third man
Johnson to Miller, no run angled in on the front foot, pushed out to the covers
Johnson to Miller, no run angled in again, landing it on a dime, the batsman can only defend down off the back foot
Johnson to Miller, FOUR runs outside off, driven hard through the covers and the ball runs away through the off side

Many thanks for joining us throughout Australia's entire tour of the Caribbean and we look forward to bringing you some more cricket soon. Don't forget to join us for England's Test series against South Africa which kicks off at Lord's this week. Until next time

So then, Australia have won the series convincingly. They weren't always at their best, but in some ways they didn't have to be. West Indies have a lot of thinking and a lot of work to be done in the next few months prior to the Champions Trophy in Pakistan in S
"It's great for Australian cricket. We have a lot of depth back at home," he says, with a nod to those replacement players - such as Luke Ronchi - who have stepped in and stepped up well.
Check out Brydon Coverdale's bulletin for a comprehensive summary of the day's action (shoud save you reading back through the text commentary, at least).

Johnson finishes with a five-for, his second in ODIs, as Australia complete a 5-0 whitewash, only the third time that's happened to West Indies on home soil. And the sealing win was emphatic - by 169 runs.
Australia won by 169 runs
Player of the match is Luke Ronchi, AUS
